Name: *data
Doc: The data to be represented in this table.

Name: page_size
Doc: For paginated table, the number of rows displayed.

Name: allow_all_rows
Doc: For paginated table, adds an option to show all rows.

Name: show_all
Doc: For paginated table, show all rows.

Name: auto_loading
Doc: data will be loaded on demand.

Name: width[col_name]
Doc: The width, in CSS units, of the indicated column.

Name: selected
Doc: The list of the indices of the rows to show as selected.

Name: page_size_options
Doc: The list of available page sizes that users can choose.

Name: columns
Doc:
The list of the column names to display.
  • str: Semicolon (';')-separated list of column names.
  • List[str]: list of column names
  • dict: a dictionary with entries matching: {"col name": {format: "format", index: 1}}.
    if index is specified, it represents the display order of the columns. If index is not specified, the list order defines the index.
    If format is specified, it is used for numbers or dates.

Name: date_format
Doc: The date format that is used for all date columns when format is not specifically defined.

Name: number_format
Doc: The number format that is used for all number columns when format is not specifically defined.

Name: group_by[col_name]
Doc:
Indicates, if True, that the given column can be aggregated.
See [below](#aggregation) for details.

Name: apply[col_name]
Doc: The name of the aggregation function to use. This is used only if group_by[column_name] is set to True. See [below](#aggregation) for details.

Name: style
Doc:
Allows the styling of table lines.
See [below](#styling) for details.

Name: style[col_name]
Doc:
Allows the styling of table cells.
See [below](#styling) for details.

Name: width
Doc: The width, in CSS units, of this table control.

Name: height
Doc: The height, in CSS units, of this table control.

Name: nan_value
Doc: The replacement text for NaN (not-a-number) values.

Name: nan_value[col_name]
Doc: The replacement text for NaN (not-a-number) values for the indicated column.

Name: on_edit
Doc:
The name of a function that is to be triggered when a cell edition is validated.
All parameters of that function are optional:
  • state (State^): the state instance.
  • var_name (str): the name of the tabular data variable.
  • action (str): the name of the action that provoked the change.
  • payload (dict): the details on this callback's invocation.
    This dictionary has the following keys:
    • index (int): the row index.
    • col (str): the column name.
    • value (any): the new cell value.
If this property is not set, the user cannot edit cells.

Name: on_delete
Doc:
The name of a function that is to be triggered when a row is deleted.
All parameters of that function are optional:
  • state (State^): the state instance.
  • var_name (str): the name of the tabular data variable.
  • action (str): the name of the action that provoked the change.
  • payload (dict): the details on this callback's invocation.
    This dictionary has the following keys:
    • index (int): the row index.
If this property is not set, the user cannot delete rows.

Name: on_add
Doc:
The name of a function that is to be triggered when the user requests a row to be added.
All parameters of that function are optional:
  • state (State^): the state instance.
  • var_name (str): the name of the tabular data variable.
  • action (str): the name of the action that provoked the change.
  • payload (dict): the details on this callback's invocation.
    This dictionary has the following keys:
    • index (int): the row index.
If this property is not set, the user cannot add rows.
